title: Regexp FindAll second argument purpose
body:
I've got a question about regexp package function

`(re *Regexp) FindAll(b []byte, n int) [][]byte`

Official documentation says

`FindAll is the 'All' version of Find; it returns a slice of all successive matches of the expression, as defined by the 'All' description in the package comment. A return value of nil indicates no match.`

But what is purpose of n int argument?

I've supposed it is uppder bound of entries count we need to retrieve, but when i set it to 1 << 32
i've got 49 entries even if i really have only 2.
